risk_factors: Criminal history: two arrests and a conviction indicate prior engagement with criminal activities.
Substance use: recent marijuana use may be a warning sign depending on viability of recovery and impact on behavior.
Mental health: reported periods of feeling extremely down might signal underlying mental health issues that can contribute to risk.
Employment instability: only holding two jobs during the year could suggest economic or social challenges.
Social isolation: living alone and limited social supports might exacerbate risk factors.
Educational background: having only a high school diploma and not being in college might limit alternatives for social mobility.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a risk assessment expert. Analyze the following risk factors to determine if they indicate high risk.
You must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}

Risk Factors to analyze:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 155 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
